title: The birth of Venus
description: The Birth of Venus is a painting make by Sandro Botticelli in the mid 1480s. It depicts the goddess Venus arriving at the shore after her birth.
alt: A naked lady standing on a massive shell surrounded by two angels and another lady who is trying to cover the naked lady with a pink fabric.

title: The Kiss
description: The Kiss is a painting made by Gustav Klimt in his Golden Period. The painting depicts a couple embracing each other, covered in beautiful robes.
alt: A couple embracing each other. Covered in a golden robe.

title: The Son of Man
description: The son of man is a oil painting made by René Magritte in 1964. Magritte painted it as a self-portrait. The painting contains a man dressed in a overcoat and a bowler hat. The mans face is largely obscured by a hovering green apple.
alt: A man standing in front a low wall. Behind him is the sea and clouds. He is dressed in a black overcoat and a black hat. In front of his face is a large green apple.

title: Lady with an Ermine
description: The Lady with an Ermine is a portrait painting made by Leonardo da Vinci. Its subject is Cecilia Gallerani, a mistress of Ludovico Sforza duke of Milan.
alt: A lady dressed in renaissance dress while she is holding a white ermine.

title: Wanderer above the Sea of Fog
description: Wanderer above the sea of fog is a oil painting made by Caspar David Friedrich. It depicts a man standing on rocks while watching over the foggy sky.
alt: A man in a dark suit standing on rocks. The sky in front of him is covered in fog. In the distance there is a forest and a large mountain.

title: Flaming June
description: Flaming June is a painting by Sir Frederic Leighton in 1895. It is thought that the woman portrayed alludes to the figure of sleeping nymphs and naiads the Greeks often sculpted.
alt: A woman in a orange dress sleeping curled up on a small couch.

title: The Swing
description: The Swing also known as The Happy Accidents of the Swing is a 18th-century oil painting by Jean-Honoré Fragonard. It is considered to be one of Fragonard's best known work.
alt: A woman swinging on a swing while a man is down on the ground. The man has a surprised expression on his face because he can see up the lady's dress.
